dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And now, from the presidential palace in Astana, a high-level diplomatic meeting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now, from the presidential palace in Astana, a high-level diplomatic meeting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: President Tokayem, uh, Kassym-Jomart Tokayev of Kazakhstan, just held closed-format talks with his Bulgarian counterpart.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: President Tokayem, uh, Kassym-Jomart Tokayev of Kazakhstan, just held closed-format talks with his Bulgarian counterpart.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President of Kazakhstan Kassym-Jomart Tokayev held talks with President of Bulgaria Rumen Radev, according to Akorda. During the closed-format talks, Kassym-Jomart Tokayev emphasized that he attaches special importance to Rumen Radev's visit in terms of further strengthening Kazakh-Bulgarian partnership.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, with President Rumen Radev. And he called the visit, like, super important for strengthening their partnership.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, with President Rumen Radev. And he called the visit, like, super important for strengthening their partnership.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the closed-format talks, Kassym-Jomart Tokayev emphasized that he attaches special importance to Rumen Radev's visit in terms of further strengthening Kazakh-Bulgarian partnership.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he really emphasized that Bulgaria is a key partner for Kazakhstan in Europe. They've got strong political and economic ties already.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he really emphasized that Bulgaria is a key partner for Kazakhstan in Europe. They've got strong political and economic ties already.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bulgaria is an important partner of Kazakhstan in Europe, with whom we share strong political and economic ties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just talk—there are around 60 Bulgarian companies operating in Kazakhstan right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just talk-there are around sixty Bulgarian companies operating in Kazakhstan right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Around 60 Bulgarian companies are successfully operating in the Kazakh market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a solid number. And the cooperation spans so many areas… politics, transport, construction…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a solid number. And the cooperation spans so many areas... politics, transport, construction...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Cooperation is developing in politics, trade, investment, and the humanitarian sphere. Our partnership is actively progressing in industry, transport, and construction, and also holds potential in energy, logistics, the green economy, nuclear sector, space, agriculture, digitalization, healthcare, and tourism, said the President of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Even the green economy and the nuclear sector, which is pretty fascinating. They see a lot of potential there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even the green economy and the nuclear sector, which is pretty fascinating. They see a lot of potential there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our partnership is actively progressing in industry, transport, and construction, and also holds potential in energy, logistics, the green economy, nuclear sector, space, agriculture, digitalization, healthcare, and tourism, said the President of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then Radev reciprocated, thanking Tokayev for the warm reception. He really values their current partnership level.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Radev reciprocated, thanking Tokayev for the warm reception. He really values their current partnership level.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In turn, Rumen Radev expressed gratitude to the Head of State for the warm welcome. He emphasized that he highly values the level of partnership between the two countries and looks forward to expanding cooperation across all areas of the bilateral agenda.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He called Kazakhstan a priority partner in Central Asia, which is a big deal. And he was seriously impressed by his tour.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He called Kazakhstan a priority partner in Central Asia, which is a big deal. And he was seriously impressed by his tour.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bulgaria values its warm and fruitful relations with Kazakhstan and considers it a priority partner in Central Asia. We admire your achievements in the economy, science, education, and technology.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, the visit to the National Space Center really stood out to him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, the visit to the National Space Center really stood out to him.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I was particularly impressed by the visit to the National Space Center, added the President of Bulgaria.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: You can tell there's a lot of mutual admiration going on—economy, science, education…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You can tell there's a lot of mutual admiration going on-economy, science, education...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We admire your achievements in the economy, science, education, and technology.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely feels like both sides are eager to expand this relationship across the board.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely feels like both sides are eager to expand this relationship across the board.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder what specific projects might come out of this meeting next.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder what specific projects might come out of this meeting next.
